intro: Stenostomum radiatum subsp. radiatum, commonly known as the radiate stenostomum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, radiating flowers with five to seven lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It is primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia.
